intro: Cuspidaria, commonly known as the "false hellebore," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Ranunculaceae. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, often yellow or white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland areas and stream sides. Cuspidaria species are perennial herbs with a short, stout rhizome and are native to regions in Europe and Asia. Due to its toxic properties, it should be handled with care.
